23 2021-02-04 swelling face Approximately 28min after vaccine administration, pt. was noted to have red/swollen face & SOB. Pt r... Read more
Close
Approximately 28min after vaccine administration, pt. was noted to have red/swollen face & SOB. Pt reported hx of severe asthma. Epi pen administered by clinic RN and pt took own albuterol inhaler at 1322. 911 called. pt reported some improvement of SOB after meds, but continued w/cough and increased work of breathing. VS showed tachycardia and hypertension after epi administration. Pt reported improvements in face swelling and throat tightness after epi administration but still appeared to have labored and tachypneic breathing despite O2 sats 98-100%. Pt placed on 2L O2 via face mask to decrease work of breathing. Pt remained A&O, but developed rigors after epi administration. Paramedics and EMS arrived at approx 1328. Pt was subsequently transported to ED for further eval per EMS report.

Close
The shot went in my arm and I immediately started feeling itchy. Before the needle was out, I knew something was wrong but almost didn?t believe how fast it happened. My throat started itching and swelling shut. I was in full blown anaphylactic shock in less than 2 minutes. I got an EpiPen shot in the parking lot and was admitted into the hospital where I continued having various reactions. A week after the shot, I?m still breaking out in hives uncontrollably.

23 2021-02-14 swelling About 1.5-2 hours post immunization the patient returned having developed a headache and a quarter s... Read more
Close
About 1.5-2 hours post immunization the patient returned having developed a headache and a quarter sized welt that was lightly red, swollen and very tender to touch, just below her left collar bone about 4 inches from the injection site. The welt was outlined and observed and the patient was given 25mg of Benadryl. After about 20 minutes the swelling and tenderness had spread to an area approximately the diameter of a tennis ball. At this point she was refered to see a doctor at the Health Center. The nurse called to follow-up once the patient arrived as she had not seen this type of reaction after the vaccine. After discussion the physician was going to look at her. Reportedly the swelling had begun to retract and the patient apparently returned to work later that day, talking about her plans to receive the second dose.

Systemic: Allergic: Itch (specify: facial area, extremeties)-Medium, Systemic: Allergic: Swelling of Face / Eyes / Mouth / Tongue-Medium, Systemic: Hypertension-Mild, Additional Details: Pt presented with swollen lips within 15 minutes of vaccination. Benadryl administered. 911 called and paramedics arrived to take to local ER. Patient's friend returned and said patient was being monitored at the ER for the next 6 to 7 hours.
23 2021-02-20 swelling face 29 minutes after being given the vaccine my tongue started itching and swelled up a bit, my mouth fe... Read more
Close
29 minutes after being given the vaccine my tongue started itching and swelled up a bit, my mouth felt dry, my face became a bit reddened, puffy, and itchy, my throat began to swell a bit and my chest felt tight, giving me some discomfort when it came to breathing. I let the nurses who were keeping an eye on those waiting for 15/30 minutes know that I was having a reaction. I waited 1 more minute, and when my throat felt tighter and I had a bit more difficulty breathing, I took 1 Benadryl tablet, and waited 2 minutes, and when the symptoms were still worsening slowly, I took a second Benadryl tablet and after a few minutes my symptoms started to go away. I waited another 10 minutes and then went home when it seemed that my symptoms were going away. At 6:45pm on 2/21/2021 my throat and chest started feeling tight again and gave me mild breathing discomfort, so I took another Benadryl tablet, a few minutes later my face began to itchy and my mouth felt dry and my tongue felt a bit swollen, whereupon I took a second Benadryl tablet at 6:56pm, and then felt a wave of nausea. At 6:59pm, the feeling of tightness had not abated, but also hadn't worsened noticeably, and the itching feeling began to spread from my face to my ears and down my neck. At 7:04pm the tightness of my throat and chest began to increase some, and I started to feel some anxiety. At 7:11pm I inhaled two puffs from an albuterol inhaler used for treating asthma as my throat and chest were continuing to slowly get tighter. At 7:26pm I still felt itchy and my throat and chest still felt tight, but it wasn't noticeably worse. At 7:35pm, my throat began to feel tight enough to give me noticeable discomfort while breathing and for me to make a slight wheezing sound while breathing, and my tongue felt like it swelled a bit more, and my mouth still felt dry. At 7:51pm the Benadryl made me feel sleepy, but had no effect on my itchy skin or tightness of throat or chest. 8:00pm, my throat and chest felt tighter and I started having some difficulty swallowing and I felt very warm. 8:05pm, I had a lot of difficulty swallowing and had trouble breathing, so I went to the Emergency Room and was given an Epinephrine shot and sent home after an hour of observation.

23 2021-03-18 peripheral swelling Seizure; Headache; Couldn't feel lower legs; Extreme chest pains and chills; Extreme chest pains and... Read more
Close
Seizure; Headache; Couldn't feel lower legs; Extreme chest pains and chills; Extreme chest pains and chills; Arm swelling; Pain; Itching; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). A 23-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number and expiration date unspecified), via an unspecified route of administration (left arm) on 02Mar2021, 16:15, as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing epilepsy, covid back in Dec2020, known allergies to flu vaccine and TB test and seizure (have history). Concomitant medications included levetiracetam (KEPPRA), lamotrigine (LAMICTAL), cenobamate (XCOPRI) and magnesium. The patient had no other vaccine in 4 weeks. On 02Mar2021 16:15, the patient experienced arm swelling, pain, itching, couldn't feel lower legs, extreme chest pains and chills. On 02Mar2021, at 17:15, the patient experienced headache an hour later. On 03Mar2021 01:00, the patient experienced seizure at the middle of the night around 01:00. The events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient had Covid prior vaccination; and was not Covid tested post vaccination. Outcome of event seizure was not recovered; outcome of the rest of events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: The patient had underlying epilepsy. However, based on the close temporal association, a possible contributory role of bnt162b2 to the development of seizure cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

23 2021-03-21 swelling face I got my vaccine on 3/19 at 10am. My 6:30 pm on 3/19 my face got dark red, almost purple and started... Read more
Close
I got my vaccine on 3/19 at 10am. My 6:30 pm on 3/19 my face got dark red, almost purple and started to swell. I went to and urgent care where they gave me a 50 mg shot of Benadryl. AFter about 20 minutes the reaction was getting better so they released me to go home. They told me to continue taking the Benadryl every 4-6 hours for the next 2-3 days. I did as directed for through the night and the next day. Around 6:30 pm on 3/20 I started feeling very tired, shaky, and dazed. My about 9:00 that evening I began to feel swelling in my throat/tongue. I then went to the emergency room and where they gave me another 50 mg shot of Benadryl and a 6 mg shot of Decadron. They monitored me for a couple hours and the swelling in my mouth had gone down and the rash that had also reappeared had gone down. They sent me home with a prescription for Prednisone 10mg 4 pills a day for 4 days and told me to continue the Benadryl. I took the Prednisone and Benadryl for all day 3/21 and was feeling better. When I woke up on 3/22, my chest and arms had a rash on them. I took a Benadryl around 7:30 and Prednisone around 8:30. I went to work and around 10:30 my face started getting red and swelling again. I contacted my dermatologist who did skin patch testing and got an appoint for 3/22 at 1:45. She extended the Prednisone out to 12 days and told me to switch to Zytrec during the day and I will follow up on three weeks.
23 2021-03-23 lymph node swelling Fatigue and myalgias set in about 6 hours after vaccine was administered Shortly after, tachycardia... Read more
Close
Fatigue and myalgias set in about 6 hours after vaccine was administered Shortly after, tachycardia set in with pulse at 140-150 bpm resting. Fever set in at 8 pm at 103F. One OTC Benadryl brought pulse down to 130s resting. Performed Valsalva Maneuver with pulse improvement to 110s. By morning, fever was still at 103F, with headache, muscle pain, chills, fatigue, pain at injection site, and swollen lymph nodes present. Tachycardia had resolved. Within 48 hours after vaccine was administered, all side effects had resolved except fatigue and swollen lymph nodes and headache. All side effects had completely resolved 9 days after vaccine was administered.

23 2021-04-08 anaphylactic reaction 23 yo FM who received first dose of Pfizer vaccine and then was noted to have shortness of breath an... Read more
Close
23 yo FM who received first dose of Pfizer vaccine and then was noted to have shortness of breath and complaining tongue closing sensation immediately after at Vaccine Clinic --I was called to evaluate the patient. When I arrived patient was laying down on a chair with a friend, shaking with seizure like activity but alert and oriented to person place and time. Upon my arrival she was shaking, vomited x 1 and then complained about chest pain. Vitals upon my arrival: HR 58, o2 100% RR appeared to be around 22-24 (hyperventilating) BP 88 systolic (manual)--repeated by medics upon arrival minutes later 110/72. Given throat closing sensation, vomiting, shortness of breath I advised to call 911 and ordered Epinephrine x 1 which was given by RN immediately. Pt was then placed on the grown chin up, she continued to shake throughout entire body but continued to be alert and oriented. Medics then arrived on seen, started an IV, glucose by medics 84, IVF started by medics. Pt was transported to ER via medics. Pt is not a patient, last visit 2017. Pt did state she has hx of POTS and DRESS syndrome to Lamictal. Reports taking cetirizine this AM, Zofran and Oxycodone and Baclofen (prescribed by external PCP?). Prior to transport to ER pt continued to be alert oriented, but shaking and twitching throughout her body. MD verbally communicated to patient to not receive the 2nd dose given her severe anaphylaxis like reaction to the first dose of the vaccine. Pt can be referred to allergist after ER follow up by PCP. Denied pregnancy.

Close
Hospital course: 23 yo female with no significant PMH presenting to the ED with right sided CP, worse with deep inspiration. Received 2nd covid vaccination last week- mild reaction with fever thereafter. She had w/u in the ED including an EKG with inferior and septal TWI and trop of 1.61. CTA chest was negative. She was admitted. After admit, troponin trended up (1.61--3.71--4.93). CRP 49.1, ESR 21. Echo showed apex hypokinesis so with TWI on EKG and elevated trop, cardiology elected for LHC. This was normal. Cardiac MRI showed myopericarditis. She was started on high dose ASA, colchicine and bblocker for this. Likely viral etiology (Covid, Resp 4 plex negative). Trop trended down on 4/13 (CRP still rising). Cardiology was ok with discharge. Will need 2 weeks of ASA and 3 months of colchicine. No strenuous activities for that time frame. She is getting her Masters in music/violin and did not need a return to school note. Feeling somewhat better at discharge- rated pain 6/10. Close
I (patient) developed swollen and painful lymph nodes in the underarms on both sides of my body. They began on the side of the injection but spread to include both arms. In addition, two similarly swollen and painful lumps have appeared, though I am not sure if they are lymph nodes given their locations. One is along my the line of my waistband in the front of my body, not in the traditional groin area where most charts ascribe lymph nodes to be. One is directly below my areola on my right breast. Along with these lumps, I developed a rash made up of several small, inflamed hives that range from painless, to itchy, to painful. They are concentrated along my bra line, particularly around my breasts, but are spread everywhere from below my neckline to above my ankles. These symptoms began approximately 7 days after my second dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine and are continuing at the time of this report.

23 2021-05-01 lymph node swelling, peripheral swelling The day following the vaccination I woke up with severe arm pain 2 inches down from the injection si... Read more
Close
The day following the vaccination I woke up with severe arm pain 2 inches down from the injection site. My arm had swollen about 3 inches in diameter. It was so painful that I could not roll over, I could not lift my arm, and I was in inconsolable tears. It was a deep stinging pain, as though I was repeatedly being stung by a hornet. My left hand was going numb off and on. I went to the doctor because I was incapable of lifting my arm, and the doctor identified that my lymph nodes and my left ear were swollen and enlarged. He recommended ibuprofen and ice for the lump. The second day after receiving the vaccine I had a mild headache, and my arm was only slightly swollen. The third day after receiving the vaccine my arm was still slightly swollen and sore, but the pain was manageable without pain medication. The fourth day after receiving the vaccine I woke up with a deep cough and dizzy spells lasting throughout the day.

I received the Pfizer second dose on May 5th and started to have an allergic reaction on May 6th at 02:32. I was not able to attend classes due to muscle pain, headache and nausea. I was having some sort of fever where I felt hot but my body was cold. I slept for the majority of the day. Around 16:35, when I woke up, I noticed a rash and that my body was feeling swollen. I took 2 Benadryl gel pills at 18:03. I felt some difficulty breathing, and itching sensation all over my body and still had a lot of tension on the left side of my jaw. I went out to eat with my boyfriend, because we had plans and he had also complained of having some cold chills from the vaccine, and he noticed that I had red marks on my hands. By May 7 10:05 I called off of work to go my doctor, because I had massive splotches of raised itchy hives all over my body. It was confirmed that I was having an allergic reaction and I received a steroid shot in my upper gluteal muscle, as well as Famotidine 20mg twice daily for 5 days and Prednisone 20mg twice daily for 5 days.

started to have hives all over her body, extra over in chest and stomach area; It was so kind of itching this morning; Had little pain in side and they had been run for kidney; whole body ache mostly like her joints specially in her hips an her knee; she was groggy almost like entire day , sinus thing was going on; she was groggy almost like entire day , sinus thing was going on; her lymph node on her left arm was very swollen like for three days and before it finally went away; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). This case is for 2nd dose. This case is split from AER# 2021552445 (BNT162B2, 1st dose). A 23-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (Lot Number: EW0167), at the age of 23-year-old, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 09May2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included dormant asthma when she was kid. The patient received unspecified concomitant medications for birth control. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: EW0169), at the age of 23-year-old, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left, on 18Apr2021 for COVID-19 immunization. The patient reported that she had been having some vaccine reaction she believed, but she went to the doctor today and they believed it to an environmental reaction but, she got the vaccine on Sunday, the evening before around 11 pm, she started to have hives all over her body, extra over in chest and stomach area and then she called registered doctor provider. They told me to take antihistamine so, took two diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) and the last night around 11 o' clock it came back still like around 24 hours and she took couple of more diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) and it was so kind of itching this morning, she took one more, but she was concern she went to the doctor, they said she reported these kind of symptoms. She had like reaction before (further clarification unknown) but this probably the most severe but she didn't believe that was an environmental was just the correlation between she getting the vaccine. Today when she went to the doctor, she had little pain in side and they had been run for kidney but like she didn't know that's the most recent one but she had other lab test in the past. She couldn't possible giving. It was reported that the diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) had made the hives go away but they usually like came back later in the night (further clarification unknown). The patient also received cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) for the events. Consumer added, "they have since gone away but she had more symptoms day after when she received the vaccine. The day after woke up with whole body ache mostly like her joints specially in her hips an her knee and she was groggy almost like entire day , sinus thing was going on and her lymph node on her left arm was very swollen like for three days and before it finally went away." Event onset date was May2021. Treatment received for the events. The events resulted in Physician Office Visit. The outcome of the event hives was unknown, of the event swollen lymph nodes was recovered in May2021, of other remain events was recovering.
23 2021-06-02 peripheral swelling Went into ER with leg pain the night of 5/14. Admitted into ICU 5/15 for deep venous thrombosis in t... Read more
Close
Went into ER with leg pain the night of 5/14. Admitted into ICU 5/15 for deep venous thrombosis in the leg and pulmonary embolisms in the lungs. Symptoms in leg started a few days prior to admittance. Was put on Heparin via shot and then IV. Clotting grew worse overnight with leg swelling, leading to an inability to walk. After increased elevation leg improved and was put on an oral dose of Eliquis. Was put on oxygen in the ICU and took portable oxygen home when discharged on 5/17. Also tested positive for strep 4/11. Was advised to file a report by my PCP.
23 2021-06-03 lymph node swelling Around 12 am after the dose of my vaccine, I got a fever, chills, body aches, headache and fatigue. ... Read more
Close
Around 12 am after the dose of my vaccine, I got a fever, chills, body aches, headache and fatigue. I knew all of these things to be normal. My arm was sore and I also knew that was expected. I could hardly move out of bed. At 0700 this morning, on 6/4, I finally got the energy to shower. That is when I noticed my lymph node in my armpit of the same arm I received my vaccine in was swollen to about the size of a tennis ball. I had a PA that I work with recommend me to go to an urgent care to be seen because she did not believe this to be normal. I received a Toradol injection and a course of antibiotics to take in case it turned out to be infected.
23 2021-06-07 neck mass I woke up 6 days after receiving the vaccine and I had some pain at my collar bone. It felt bruised ... Read more
Close
I woke up 6 days after receiving the vaccine and I had some pain at my collar bone. It felt bruised and I felt something that felt like a ball rolling around. I called advice from clinic and they scheduled me a visit with Dr. for a video visit. At my visit with him, I explained what it was and I mentioned that I heard about lymph node enlargement after the vaccine. He told me that he hadn't heard anything about that, but scheduled an ultrasound for me. I scheduled an appt with my PCP and she told me that she did hear about the lymph node enlargement from the vaccine. I had the ultrasound on 03/30 and the results came back benign. Dr. called with my results and requested a follow up in 3 months.

Severe burning of skin over entire body; Hypersensitive to touch including fabric; Swollen neck and hands; Swollen neck and hands; Pain in pelvic area and anus; Pain in pelvic area and anus; Severe lower back pain accompanied with chills; Severe lower back pain accompanied with chills; Headache; Fever; Nausea; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 23-year-old non-pregnant female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer covid-19 vaccine, Solution for Injection, Lot number: EW0202), via an unspecified route in the right arm on 04Jun2021 at 11:00, as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included topiramate 50mg and norethrindrone 35mg (medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination). Patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer covid-19 vaccine, Lot number: EW0202), via on an unspecified route in the right arm on 14May2021 at 11:00, as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. Patient has not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has not been tested for COVID-19. On 04Jun2021 at 22:00, patient experienced severe burning of skin over entire body, hypersensitive to touch including fabric, swollen neck and hands, pain in pelvic area and anus, severe lower back pain accompanied with chills, headache, fever, nausea and fatigue. Patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the events was not recovered at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

23 2021-06-16 swelling face dizziness; Nausea; Not feeling well; Left arm pain; fever; Chills; Facial swelling; pain to neck; Mu... Read more
Close
dizziness; Nausea; Not feeling well; Left arm pain; fever; Chills; Facial swelling; pain to neck; Muscle spasm in face (lips); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 23-years-old non- pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot no: EN6207) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 13Mar2021 at 14:00 (at the age of 23-years-old) as a first dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patients medical history included diabetic, arthritis, fibromyalgia, High blood pressure, neuropathy and Gastrointestinal (GI) problems. Patient was allergic to Benadryl and certain anaesthesia. Concomitant medication taken within two weeks included ADVIL, HUMALOG, aspirin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), lisinopril (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), FURMIDE, gaba (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) all taken for unknown indications from unknown dates. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient had not been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. On 13Mar2021, at 14:30 the patient developed dizziness, immediately after dizziness patient had nausea, the patient was not feeling well and had left arm pain, fever, chills, facial swelling and pain to neck and muscle spasms in face (lip). The facility where the vaccine was administered was reported to be other. No therapeutic measures were taken for these adverse events. The outcome of the events dizziness, nausea, was not feeling well, left arm pain, fever, chills, facial swelling, pain to neck and muscle spasms in face (lip) was recovering at the time of report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
23 2021-06-21 lymph node swelling, axillary mass 23 y/o with hx of hodgkins lymphoma (completed tx in 2016), anxiety, and depression and today noted ... Read more
Close
23 y/o with hx of hodgkins lymphoma (completed tx in 2016), anxiety, and depression and today noted L axillary lump and here for evaluation. Covid 2nd vaccine 2 days ago in L arm. PE: afeb/nontoxic, remarkable for 2x2 cm, tender, rubbery, mobile, nonfluctuant lymph node medial aspect of L axilla c/w local reaction to covid vaccination. Symptoms most consistent with known side-effect of COVID-19 vaccine of ipsilateral axillary lymphadenopathy, and is likely self-limited. Systemic infection is also possible, though less likely given time course. Unlikely recurrence of lymphoma with absence of B symptoms. Recommended Tylenol for pain. Provided reassurance and recommended following up with PCP if persists longer than 1 week.
23 2021-06-30 peripheral swelling, peripheral swelling Within the first day, my hands felt swollen and would not stop tingling. I had awful chest pain and ... Read more
Close
Within the first day, my hands felt swollen and would not stop tingling. I had awful chest pain and neck numbness 24 hours after the vaccine. Two days after the vaccine, I felt fatigued, had a very rapid heart beat (130 bpm while sitting), and had hypertension (BP: 182/92). I had to go to the emergency room twice due to high blood pressure and a very rapid heart beat (both visits were on the Staurday two days after my vaccine). For 9 whole days after the vaccine, I felt fatigued, no appetite, I was not able to sleep, and I felt lots of chest paint.

A couple days after my first vaccine I noticed an enlarged lymph node near my collarbone. It got smaller over time but was still there in April, which is when I decided to get it checked by my primary care doctor.
23 2021-07-02 swelling Tachycardia; Motion sickness; Numbness of right forearm; Entire body swelling all extremities; itchy... Read more
Close
Tachycardia; Motion sickness; Numbness of right forearm; Entire body swelling all extremities; itchy red rash: face, neck, upper chest, forearms, thighs, back eyebrows; severe frontal occipital lateral stabbing headache; sore & tender body; sore & tender body; chills; blurry vision; light sensitivity; foggy memory; swollen neck/neck was swelling; nauseated vomiting/Nausea and vomiting; nauseated vomiting/Nausea and vomiting; burning sensation; Right upper shoulder discomfort with swelling that goes into her neck; Light sensitivity; having a rash; rash is itching; scaling, and her skin is peeling; scaling, and her skin is peeling; redness; severe headache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse (patient's mother). A 23-year-old female patient (daughter) received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTEC COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: ER8737 and expiry date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, in Arm Left, on 07Apr2021 at 11:00 AM (age at vaccination: 23 year) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccine in four weeks. The patient's medical history included anemic, eczema, gastric reflex, known allergies: citrus food, latex gloves, Compazine, Augment, and headaches from concussions. Concomitant medications included Ferrous Sulfate, Diethylpropion HCL, and glucose, sodium chloride (DNS). The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior vaccination. The patient was not tested for COVID post vaccination. There was a product complaint to report. On 07Apr2021 12:30, the patient experienced swollen neck/neck was swelling, nauseated vomiting/nausea and vomiting, entire body swelling all extremities, itchy red rash: face, neck, upper chest, forearms, thighs, back eyebrows, severe frontal occipital lateral stabbing headache, sore, tender body and chills. On 07Apr2021, the patient experienced right upper shoulder discomfort with swelling that goes into her neck, light sensitivity, having a rash, rash is itching, her skin is peeling, redness and severe headache. On 09Apr2021, the patient experienced motion sickness and numbness of right forearm. On 12Apr2021, the patient had tachycardia and scaling. When probed to determine when the tachycardia began, the caller mentioned that the tachycardia was noted at the doctor's office. She confirmed the tachycardia began Monday, 12Apr2021. She clarified it was her second doctor's visit so if the caller gave the wrong date, they were able to find it by her records on her second doctor's visit. Caller confirmed with her daughter the tachycardia was still intermittent, it comes and goes. It seems to be that it has improved. She could consider it was medically significant because they didn't know what the root cause was. Her daughter has never experienced tachycardia before being dosed with the Pfizer vaccine. There was not treatment for tachycardia. Her daughter was still having a rash; she was breaking out intermittently. She confirmed she did not report online that her daughter was intermittently breaking out. At that time when she filed the report online, the rash just broke out. At that time, she didn't know if her daughter's rash was going to abate and then re-appear. If so, then she would have had to re-open a new event with a new date and time and rate it. She just looked at her daughter's skin, it's peeling. These were very itchy. Caller then clarified most of these events started the day of the vaccine, 07Apr2021 at 12:30 PM. She confirmed some of these events were reported online on the date of the incident and were still present. The severity of each event was on a grading scale, and right now her daughter's grading scale was 10. Online, the patient couldn't even tell how they really were feeling. The severity of each event needed to be asked. By the lack of getting all the information and the less Pfizer has, the better it looks for Pfizer. When probed for outcome, the caller confirmed the rash was still ongoing and it was medically significant because she was going to have to take her to dermatologist. She has been using hydrocortisone cream as treatment of the rash and it's not working. She did not have the NDC, LOT,EXP for the cream. She explained the skin peeling/scaling has been ongoing. Her skin breaks out in a rash and then becomes really scaly and then it peels. She clarified overall, she had a rash, but the rash was itching, had redness, scaling, and her skin was peeling. On scale of 1 to 10, the caller would rate this event as a 10. She confirmed and that it's continuous/ongoing and had not improved. Stated the rash was not to any localized area on her daughter's body, it's all over. She clarified further the rash can appear on her daughter's eyes, chin, cheeks, forearm, wrist, and leg. The severe headache was reported on the day of the vaccine as well as the rash, too. The severe headache was ongoing; caller gives it a grade 10+. She confirmed the headache was medically significant. It did prevent her daughter from driving a car, reading, or doing activities. Caller added that the headache was also disabling because it disables her daughter from functioning at her normal capacity, she's been hindered. Her normal activities she could not perform if the headache was present. The headache was described as stabbing, excruciating pain and burning sensation. When probed for the outcome of her daughter's severe headache, the caller explains it's in between persistent and worsening. On a good day, it's a grade 8.5. On a bad day, it's a grade 10+. No medical treatment for headache, she was not really allowed to do anything. She was waiting for Pfizer vaccine to wash out of her daughter's system. She explained her daughter was laying low and not introducing any more drugs to enter her body since she had a reaction. Caller again stated they were waiting for Pfizer's vaccine to wash out of her daughter's system because they feel as though something was triggering the rash that keeps appearing and the headaches were still there on a grade level of 10+. Her daughter was afraid to take medications, so they were having to do treatments like hot compresses to her daughter's head and neck, massaging her head/neck/back and turning the lights off. The Nausea and vomiting began on 07Apr2021 and was still ongoing. No treatment for nausea. Her daughter just gets still and goes to sleep. When the headaches were excruciating, it brings on nausea and vomiting. Also, she noticed motion sickness. When her daughter was riding in the car and she was experiencing a headache, she had terrible motion sickness. Caller confirmed the caller never had this motion sickness prior to the vaccine. The motion sickness was still ongoing. Her daughter was not treating the motion sickness in any way. She states maybe her daughter has taken one Zofran because it was so bad. No further details provided. The numbness of the right forearm started on 09Apr2021. She confirms the numbness is still ongoing, it comes and goes, intermittently and did not receive any treatment. On 07Apr2021, her entire neck was swelling, left and right side. The left side was better but the rightnside had intermittent swelling, there was ongoing swelling on the right side of her neck and did not receive any treatment and just rubbing of her daughter's neck. Her daughter also has right upper shoulder discomfort with swelling that goes into her neck that was ongoing. She confirmed this event to be medically significant and it has hindered her daughter's normal activity if her shoulder was swollen too bad and she was hurting. Her daughter just started physical therapy. The light sensitivity was still ongoing. If her daughter was not experiencing a headache, the light sensitivity was pretty good and treatment included dark rooms/ black out. Her daughter was following up with an allergy testing by the allergy doctor. She has to find out if there were any active ingredients in the Pfizer vaccine that triggered her daughter's reaction. Caller stated, "something in the COVID-19 vaccine triggered her daughter's body to react the way that it did". Her daughter also was following up with a dermatologist. Her primary care physician requested her daughter to be followed up with her allergy doctor and to be tested. Caller requested Pfizer's adverse team or someone to call and let the caller know how Pfizer follows up with their patients and how well Pfizer's values each patient. The patient's symptoms have not abated. The events of swelling, nausea, vomiting, tachycardia, motion sickness, hypoaesthesia, musculoskeletal discomfort, photophobia, rash, rash pruritic, skin exfoliation, erythema and headache were considered to be medically significant. The events caused the patient to visit emergency department and physician's office. The patient received IM Benadryl 50mg and IM Solumedrol steroid as treatment for the events. The outcome of tachycardia was recovering and for burning sensation it was unknown, and for all the other events, it was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: There is a reasonable possibility that the events nausea, vomiting, pruritic rash, erythema, and severe headache were related to BNT162b2 based on known drug safety profile and close temporal relationship. The association between the events swelling, tachycardia, motion sickness, hpyoaesthesia, musculoskeletal discomfort, photophobia, skin peeling, and scaly skin with BNT162b2 can not be fully excluded based on temporal relationship. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin; Abormal/low values were in the following: lymph, monocyte %, eosinophil %, BUN.; Abormal/low values were in the following: lymph, monocyte %, eosinophil %, BUN.; Abormal/low values were in the following: lymph, monocyte %, eosinophil %, BUN.; Abormal/low values were in the following: lymph, monocyte %, eosinophil %, BUN.; headaches; fever; fatigue; night sweats; chills; loss of appetite; cough; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer reported for herself that a 23-year-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-Biontech COVID-19 Vaccine, solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EN6206), (at the age of 23-year-old) via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 11Mar2021 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. She had no known allergies. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. No other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 14Mar2021, for the past 6 days now, she had been experiencing the following symptoms: headaches, fever, fatigue, night sweats, chills, loss of appetite, and a cough. Got blood tests done on the 16Mar2021, abnormal/high values were in the following: WBC, Neutro, immature granulocyte, neutro absolute, immature granulocyte absolute, AST, bilirubin and abormal/low values were in the following: lymph, monocyte %, eosinophil %, BUN. The adverse event resulted in emergency room. There was no covid prior vaccination. On 16Mar2021, she had covid test post vaccination by nasal swab which resulted in negative. No treatment for event was provided. The outcome of the events was not recovered. Information about lot/batch number was obtained. Additional information has been requested.

A 23-years-old non pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: ER8727) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 20Mar2021 at 16:30 (at the age of 23-years-old) as single for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included asthma, environmental allergy to trees, molds, animals and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Concomitant medications included vyvanse (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), loratadine (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), breo ellipta (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) and birth control pill. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient experienced pain in arm after two days of vaccination and on 27Mar2021 at 12:00, red welt for about 3 inches in diameter after 7 days of vaccination, which was raised off from the skin around a defined red circle which caused the upper arm to swell, was hot to touch and itchy. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The adverse events resulted in doctor or other health care professional or clinic visit. The patient did not receive any treatments for the adverse events. The clinical outcome of welts, skin red, swelling arm, hot dry skin, itchy were recovering at the time of the report. The clinical outcome of the pain in arm was recovered at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts needed. No further information expected.

On 12/24/2020 started developing severe headaches with dizziness. On 12/27/2020 started getting chills, muscle aches, got covid tested (negative). On 12/29/2020 face and eyes started to swell, another covid test (negative). Continuous chills, sweats. 24 2021-01-02 anaphylactic reaction Anaphylaxis. The COVID shot was given, no reaction then. After 7 minutes, congestion, severe cough... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis. The COVID shot was given, no reaction then. After 7 minutes, congestion, severe cough, vomiting phlegm, feeling like throat closing started happening. Code was called, Benadryl was immediately given intramuscular in the left arm, blood pressure, pulse ox was taken, and then was taken to the Emergency Department. In the ED, I was given prednisone, one EPI, anti-nausea medication all through I.V. and many more medications given to me via I.V. that I don't sincerely remember. I was under observation for 4 hours. I was discharged after all symptoms dissipated and was given Prednisone 20 MG (3 tabs a day) to take to help my lungs. Management followed up almost immediately, everyone from the moment I had the anaphylactic reaction was quick and prepared.

Close
Initial headache 30 min post vaccination and lasted for 1 hour. On 12/25/2020 tenderness noted in left armpit (lt injection arm). Tenderness persisted and worsened through 1/4/2021. On 1/4/2021 a lump was noted inferior lateral left neck. Ultrasound proved multiple enlarged lymph nodes in left axilla and left neck.
24 2021-01-05 lymph node swelling, swelling, lymph node pain Patient is a 24 years old female seen today for Follow-Up (Received covid vax on 12/23, swollen, pai... Read more
Close
Patient is a 24 years old female seen today for Follow-Up (Received covid vax on 12/23, swollen, painful lymphnodes in L armpit and L side of neck) The LE is seen today on call with chief complaint of swelling of the left anterior neck. She received the Pfizer co bid 19 vaccine on 12/23 in the upper outer left on her. On the 25th she noted some discomfort in the axilla which then persisted all week. She did not have any fever or chills or malaise. She noted no redness in the axilla or in the area of the injection. She then developed visible swelling in the anterior left side of her neck and a sonogram was done which shows 6 areas of enlargement the largest one is 1.7 cm in diameter. Patient has the image on her phone and this was reviewed with her. She has no discomfort in the right axilla and no swelling elsewhere in the neck. She has no history of similar swelling.

Close
1/7/2021- felt dizzy/nauseas about 30 minutes after injection. 1/8/2021 AM started having soreness in injection site, and some red spots on right hand. PM starting having extreme itching on dorsal sides of hands, used lotion that I normally use (sensitive skin kind) to see if it was just dryness. Red bumps still on just right hand 1/9/2021 woke up in middle of night to extreme itching and spreading red bumps on both hands. Bumps are small and fluid filled. Took Benadryl and went back to bed after washing hands. Early PM continued extreme itching and spreading bumps to wrists becoming more red and some bumps popping. Later in evening I noticed swelling starting in my hands. I have tried Benadryl cream (not difference) washing hands well (no difference) lotion (worse) hydrocortisone 1% cream (itching worse) swelling went from none to a non pitting edema. Hands hurt and swelling increasing over time more bumps showing up on hands (with no other changes to any products I have used)

At approximately 11pm felt dizziness and coworker followed her home. When arriving home noticed facial swelling, some shortness of breath, itchy neck, "jittery", and swollen throat. Taken by boyfriend to ED at approximately 12am on 12/17/2020. Given Epipen, diphenhydramine, famotidine, and methylprednisolone. 24 2021-01-19 swelling The day after receiving my second dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, I experienced minor side effe... Read more
Close
The day after receiving my second dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, I experienced minor side effects, including elevated temperature (99.8 F), headache, and soreness in my arm at the injection site. This lasted the whole day. The day after that, my temperature was back to normal (98.1 F), no headache, and the soreness had subsided significantly, but I am experiencing some swelling and soreness in my right armpit.

24 2021-01-25 lymph node swelling Chills; Fever (up to 101.8ºF ); Headache; Nausea; Fatigue; Body Aches; Swollen lymph nodes; This is... Read more
Close
Chills; Fever (up to 101.8ºF ); Headache; Nausea; Fatigue; Body Aches; Swollen lymph nodes; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 24-year-old female patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL1283, expiry date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 07Jan2021 08:00 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was not reported. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included ibuprofen (ADVIL), paracetamol (TYLENOL), calcium carbonate (TUMS), citalopram and birth control (unspecified medication). The patient previously took first dose of bnt162b2 (lot number: EJ1685, expiry date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 20Dec2020 11:00 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. On 07Jan2021 18:30, the patient experienced chills, fever (up to 101.8ºF), headache, nausea, fatigue, body aches and swollen lymph nodes. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included aars-cov-2 test: negative on 08Jan2021 COVID test result=Negative. No treatment was received for the adverse events. Clinical outcome of the events recovered on an unspecified date.

Swollen/tender lymph nodes under right arm; Swollen/tender lymph nodes under right arm; Hard for movement; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable nurse (patient). A 24-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number and expiry date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on the right arm, on 18Jan2021 08:00 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history was not reported. Patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. There were no other medications received within 2 weeks of vaccination. The patient experienced swollen/tender lymph nodes under right arm and hard for movement on 19Jan2021 08:00. Patient was recovering from the events and no treatment was received. The events were considered non-serious. Patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination and had not been tested since the vaccination. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

Close
Received the vaccine on the morning of 1/13/2021 and started feeling fatigued the night of 1/13/2021. My arm the injection was given in was swollen and raised and red and warm to the touch . The swelling lasted for about 5 days and started on the eve of the injection day. The next morning, 1/14/2021, I woke up with bone pain, body aches, fatigue, and a swollen lymph node on my left lower neck. I had chills, but never ran a fever. I also suffered from headache on 1/14/2021. On 1/15/2021, I woke up and all symptoms had resolved.

24 2021-02-28 swelling The patient presents today with a history of recurrent urticaria and angioedema. She received a dos... Read more
Close
The patient presents today with a history of recurrent urticaria and angioedema. She received a dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday Feb 25th (lot number EN 6206). She felt fine after her shot, but the next day felt fatigued, had chills, body aches, and left arm soreness (at the site of the injection)--she attributed her symptoms to her vaccination. Friday evening, prior to bed, she noticed the onset of several scattered hives. The next day, she noted that she had more extensive hives over her body, including her eyelids, and she said that she has been having dyspnea; she presented to the ER and was treated with steroids and antihistamines. The symptoms or urticaria returned the next day with significant angioedema of the lips, and the patient had dyspnea and nausea/abdominal discomfort, and the patient went back to the ER. With antihistamines and steroids, her symptoms improved significantly and she was sent home. Her symptoms returned today, now accompanied by throat globus as well as abdominal discomfort--she self administered an Epipen, which she said significantly helped her symptoms.
24 2021-03-03 lymph node swelling had a swollen lymph node under clavicle for a month; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable... Read more
Close
had a swollen lymph node under clavicle for a month; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 24-year-old female patient (currently 25-years-old) received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration (at the age of 24-years-old) on 06Jan2021 12:45 at 0.3 mL, single in right deltoid for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EH9899, expiry date: 31Mar2021), via an unspecified route of administration on 16Dec2020 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had a swollen lymph node under clavicle for a month on 09Jan2021 13:00 with outcome of not recovered. She reported, "I've had both doses of the vaccine. The last one was on 06Jan2021. I have had a swollen lymph node under clavicle for a month." She says she got the second dose 06Jan2021 and on 09Jan2021 she was at the doctor's office and he felt what he thought is a swollen lymph node like under her clavicle, it is the size of a golf ball now, it is not going away. She says the swollen lymph node is under the clavicle on her left side. The doctor didn't seem too concerned about it but it has been almost a month and it is still there she doesn't know what it is but it is still there. She confirms the second dose was 06Jan2021 and on 09Jan2021 her doctor noticed it was swollen, she didn't even notice it before he did. She thinks it has gotten worse but she also might be freaking out for no reason but she thinks it has gotten bigger. She says she has the information for the first dose but the second dose is on another card because she forgot the card when she went back for the second dose. The information for the second dose is at home and she is not at home right now. She does not see an NDC Number. She says the lot number information could be available later if needed for follow up because the card is at home. Dose: It is not on the card but she thinks it is 0.3 ml, she doesn't remember for sure. At the time she got the dose she was being treated for ring worm. Her doctor did draw a Calcium and a PTH and they were both normal. She says the doctor was not too concerned about but it has been almost a month and it still has not gone down (as reported). She has asthma which she has been dealing with kind of on and off because this winter has been so cold but other than that nothing else has happened, her vitals are normal she did not even have any temperature or anything after the vaccine. The event was assessed as non-serious. Vaccination Facility Type was hospital. The adverse event did not require a visit to the Emergency Room or Physician Office. It was noted while she was in the doctors office but she has not had to go back for it. No prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

24 2021-03-11 peripheral swelling, anaphylactic reaction, swelling face, swelling Anaphylaxis - Throat swelled almost completely closed, wheezing, lightheadedness (nearly passed out)... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis - Throat swelled almost completely closed, wheezing, lightheadedness (nearly passed out), throat/neck and injection site were very itchy and swollen, face/eyes swelled up, turned very pale all over, heart palpitations, etc. The next day - severe, horribly painful burning sensation all throughout my body. Even clothing lightly touching my skin felt like hot razors cutting in to me. Residual swelling of the face/ arm. Migraine. For two weeks after - Very large, hard lump under my skin at the injection site. It was about the size of my hand and was very painful. After a few weeks it went away. Treatment- large amounts of benadryl. The pharmacist wanted to use an epipen and send me to the hospital, but I refused because I could still get some air in (doctor later told me that my reaction was so severe I should have gone to the hospital). I had to keep taking large amounts of benadryl for the next few days to keep the reaction down a bit.

24 2021-03-31 anaphylactic reaction About an hour after receiving the vaccine I was lightheaded, nauseated and my tongue began to get it... Read more
Close
About an hour after receiving the vaccine I was lightheaded, nauseated and my tongue began to get itchy and swollen like the beginning of an anaphylactic reaction. I took some Benadryl and Pepcid like I would for an allergic reaction. Then I went to urgent care. While I was waiting to see the doctor at urgent care my throat began to spasm and tighten and I had trouble breathing, this was about two hours after I got my vaccine. I was given a steroid and a muscle relaxant. My throat was quite sore for a few days after, but besides that I felt much better after I was given the steroid and muscle relaxer

24 2021-04-12 anaphylactic reaction 24 yo female who presents to the ED for concern for anaphylaxis after receiving her second dose of t... Read more
Close
24 yo female who presents to the ED for concern for anaphylaxis after receiving her second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Patients presents as a rapid response after receiving Epi pen to her thigh at 11:18AM. She reports that after getting the vaccine, she was sitting in the monitoring area. At the 10 min mark she noted that she had a slight cough and some eye tearing. She went to the bathroom and noticed that her eyes were swollen and she could barely open them. Someone told her that her lip looked swollen but she did not look at it in the bathroom. She also felt some throat tightness but no wheezing. She had nausea prior to vaccine, no vomiting. She had no lightheadedness or palpitations and no itching or rash anywhere. She got an Epipen at 11:18AM. A rapid response was called and she was brought to the ED. She has no personal or family history of allergic reactions and no known allergies.

Took of fexofenadine and of diphenhydramine (Benadryl). Went to sleep. Monday 4/12 7 AM - Woke up and noticed severe rash on arms and legs. Swelling on face had decreased, but still noticeable. Received second dose of vaccine on 4/11/2021 and felt fine after. On 4/12/2021, I had a headache and felt tired which I heard is common. What's uncommon is that on 4/14/2021, I began to get hives on my stomach and I've never had a hives break-out before receiving my second vaccine dose. On 4/15/2021, I wake up with hives all over my back, butt, stomach, shoulders and arms. My daily routine hasn't changed accept for getting my second vaccine dose. On 4/16/2021, I wake up at 1am with hives all over my body in the same places as 4/15/2021 but now my face was slightly swollen especially around my under eye area. Throughout each day, the hives would go away but they would come back at night.
24 2021-04-18 anaphylactic reaction Anaphylaxis; Lightheaded/Dizziness; Throat Swelling; Scratchy Throat; This is a spontaneous report f... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis; Lightheaded/Dizziness; Throat Swelling; Scratchy Throat; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 24-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EP6955), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 12Apr2021 at 09:30 (at 24-year-old, not pregnant at the time of vaccination) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies: tree nuts. The patient had Covid-19 prior vaccination. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. No other vaccine was received in four weeks. No other medications were received in two weeks. On 12Apr2021 at 10:00 AM, the patient experienced anaphylaxis; lightheaded/dizziness; scratchy throat; throat swelling. The events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care, life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events included epinephrine and steroids to prevent swelling. The outcome of the events was recovered on an unspecified date in Apr2021. The patient did not have covid test post vaccination.

A week later, I had an anaphylactic reaction to a kit kat bar. I had previously ate kit kats with no issue. I had to be intubated and hospitalized. After extubation, I continued to have anaphylaxis at least once a day with no correlation to what I was eating or drinking. I also began having a severe auto immune flare up with body pains in my legs, back, and stomach immobilizing me with generalized weakness.

Close
Left arm extreme sorensss; supraclavicular node swelling; bone and joint pain; bone and joint pain; fever; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). A 24-year-old female patient received dose 2 of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 26Mar2021 at 11:00 (at the age of 24-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included an allergy to sulfa. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient had not been diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to the vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. Concomitant medications included spironolactone from an unknown date for an unspecified indication and drospirenone, ethinyl estradiol betadex clathrate (YAZ) from an unknown date for birth control. The patient previously received dose 1 of BNT162B2 on an unspecified date as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. On 26Mar2021 at 22:00 the patient experienced left arm extreme soreness, supraclavicular node swelling, bone and joint pain, and fever. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The outcomes of left arm extreme soreness, supraclavicular node swelling, bone and joint pain, and fever were recovering. It was also reported that since the vaccine, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The lot number for the vaccine, BNT162B2, was not provided and will be requested during follow-up.

Patient went to Emergency room on 4/27 upon waking up and seeing that the rash spread to the rest of their body. The swelling/rash was painful to touch. Patient was given steroids. Exact times are unknown, but symptoms began 48 hours post vaccination per pt.

body-wide hives, chest pain,, shortness of breath, swollen hands and feet, dizziness, upset stomach, vomiting, low grade fever, fatigue, sore throat. Woke up this morning, all symptoms remain aside from chest pain, though the hives are considerably worse.
24 2021-04-28 swelling Tightening; heating up; swelling of throat; swelling of throat and chest; throat closing; shortness ... Read more
Close
Tightening; heating up; swelling of throat; swelling of throat and chest; throat closing; shortness of breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 24-year-old non-pregnant female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EW0153), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 10Apr2021 at 14:00 (at the age of 24-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included COVID-19 diagnosis in May2020, COVID-19 test taken via nasal swab on 01May2020 was positive. The patient had never had an allergic reaction in her life and she was not allergic to anything that she knew of. There were no concomitant medications (no medications within 2 weeks prior to vaccination). The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine.The patient received her first vaccine on 10Apr2021. After the shot she felt her throat closing. She experienced Tightening, heating up, swelling of throat and chest within 10 minutes of vaccine administration, also reported as at 14:15. They called the Paramedics, who gave her Benadryl injection when they picked her up from the site where she received her vaccination, which was a drug store. She was then transported to the emergency department. She was hospitalized and treated with Benadryl injection for the Tightening, heating up, swelling of throat and chest. She was monitored for 3-4 hours, and her symptoms were not worsening and she was able to leave the hospital. Ever since, this is the 9th day, everyday she had severe shortness of breath. She had no wheezing. Her chest clenches. It scared her so she had gone to the Emergency Department 2 more times for it. She had gone there 3 times in total. She had been to the Emergency Room a few times and saw doctors there. Her throat closing stopped later that evening and had come back about 4 times. Since then, she was not sure if it was just the sensation of the throat closing because it is coupled with shortness of breath. She had the sensation of throat closing about 4 times. She was short of breath every day since receiving the vaccine and up to 4 times each day. Sometimes it was worse than others. She had it while on the call (19Apr2021) and rated it 4/10. On 14Apr2021 she went to the Emergency Department in the middle of the night. She rated that episode as 9/10. Episodes of symptoms had been ongoing and reoccurring since the day of vaccine administration. She had a COVID-19 test post vaccination in Apr2021 (unknown results). The outcome of Tightening/ Chest tightness, heating up, swelling of throat and chest, throat closing and severe shortness of breath was not recovered.

24 2021-05-01 anaphylactic reaction During the post-vaccination observation, patient started to feel weak and turn pale. Our pharmacy br... Read more
Close
During the post-vaccination observation, patient started to feel weak and turn pale. Our pharmacy brought patient back to the pharmacist in the immunization. She began to experience the anaphylactic reaction and a dose of Epipen 0.3mg was given to patient by the pharmacist. The pharmacist called 911 and after a few minutes patient started to feel better and and skin turned back to normal. Pharmacist continued to observed patient until paramedic team arrived.

EMT took patients vital signs at 1033. BP: 140/111, pulse: 72, RR: 20. EMT reassessed patient at 1040. Patient stated that she was feeling a lot better and less anxious. EMT retook patients vital signs at 1042. BP: 142/108, pulse: 66, RR: 20. Patient had completed her observation time. Patient left at 1045 by herself, unassisted with a steady gait.

24 2021-06-03 bursitis Suspected bursitis with prolonged arm pain and weakness 2 weeks after first Pfizer dose. On the day ... Read more
Close
Suspected bursitis with prolonged arm pain and weakness 2 weeks after first Pfizer dose. On the day of vaccination, I had a panic attack and nearly blacked out after vaccination, something that had never happened to me after a vaccination. Once the pain started a few hours after vaccination, it significantly increased. I experienced excruciating pain in my left arm like I had never felt after any other vaccination. Complete inability to move my arm without pain; the pain persisted even with zero movement whatsoever. Within the first 12 hours the pain spread to my entire left shoulder, and within 24 hours the pain spread to my neck, and general upper left quadrant of my body to the point where inhaling deeply would cause chest pain on my left side. This extreme pain persisted for about 3-4 days. After about the 5th day, my left arm still felt different and weaker than my right arm but little pain remained. After the 7th day, pain started back up whenever I tried to use my arm in any way. The days went on and the pain and arm weakness is not passing. It is minor pains, aches, and occasional throbbing compared to those first few days after vaccination but chronic pain nonetheless. My left arm continues to feel weak and I have a concentrated area of pain directly where the vaccination site was, it's as if I could still feel exactly where the needle went through my body. My arm feels okay pain-wise upon waking most days but I am unable to do anything as simple as chopping vegetables or washing dishes without feeling pain for the rest of the day. I am unable to even wear a backpack for more than 10 minutes without my left shoulder hurting and feeling fatigued.
24 2021-06-06 peripheral swelling I got the vaccine some time in the night when i was taking a shower i noticed arm soreness. when i w... Read more
Close
I got the vaccine some time in the night when i was taking a shower i noticed arm soreness. when i went to bed around 11pm from the top of my shoulder down to my finger tips it was swollen and had arm pain. I tried to go to bed and about 30 minutes later i went to get up to grab some advil. I checked in the mirror to see if there was redness and got light headed. Next thing i know i passed out. I woke up on the floor and a big pool of blood i dont know how long i was out for. I had a nose bleed and had a bruise on my head, I could leave the bath room because i was shaking so bad and couldnt use any force to get up. After 45 mins that i went to my room and called my mom who is a physican i sat on the floor for 3 or 4 hours until i could get the nose bleed to stop. I ended up then getting into bed and the shacking had stopped after 800 mg of advil. I checked my pupils for signs of cuncussion. the 1/25 i had my first appointment and we checked to see if i broke my nose. after that the next days they did see signs of concussion with sleeping 20 hours a day and blurry vision. I went back to med center to get an mri and eeg to see about the concussion because they were worried since i didnt know how long i was out for. They also sent me to a concussion specialist. I had follow up care about the concussion for a month or so. For about a week floowing the vaccine i was taking 800mg 3times a day for the tremor's and fever

Fever; Flu like symptoms; Swollen lymph nodes; Threw up; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 24-year-old non-pregnant female patient received second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: Unknown) via unspecified route of administration in left arm on 17Mar2021 at 18:00 (at the age of 24-year-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: Unknown) via unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 24Feb2021 at 18:00 (at the age of 24-year-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not have any other medical history and any known allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications included LEXAPRO (escitalopram oxalate), metformin, YAZ (drospirenone, ethinylestradiol betadex clathrate), ZYRTEC (cetirizine hydrochloride), Vitamin b12 (cyanocobalamin), Vitamin d3 (colecalciferol), all taken for unknown indications from unknown dates. On 18Mar2021 at 05:00, 11 hours after vaccination, the patient threw up and had fever and flu like symptoms for the following 18 hours at 23:00 and also swollen lymph nodes. The patient did not receive treatment for vomiting, fever, flu like symptoms and swollen lymph nodes. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of vomiting, fever, flu like symptoms and swollen lymph nodes was recovered on an unspecified date. Information about lot/ batch number cannot be obtained. No further information is expected. Amendment: This follow-up report is being submitted to amend previously reported information: concomitant drug updated, event onset time for events fever, flu like symptoms and swollen lymph nodes updated to 18Mar2021 23:00 and narrative updated accordingly.

Swollen lymph node; low grade fever; Severe nausea; Felt dizzy and lightheaded; Sore arm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable health care professional, the patient. A 24-year-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EPT534), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 17Mar2021 at 15:15 (at the age of 24-year-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patients medical history included GERD, 4 knees surgery (reportedly one was in last month) and spring allergies. The patient was allergic to azithromycin, chlorohexidine and tramadol. Concomitant medications included omeprazole(MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), ibuprofen(MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), acetaminophen(MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) and loratadine (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) for unknown indications since unknown dates. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 17Mar2021 at 15:15, the patient experienced severe nausea approximately 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, while she sat down and immediately felt she might puke, dizzy and lightheaded, which only lasted for around 5-10 minutes. On an unknown date in Mar2021, the patient experienced typical sore arm for 3 days and on 20Mar2021, reportedly on the third day the patient experienced swollen lymph node in her armpit and low-grade fever (99.5) The patient did not receive any treatment for the adverse events. The adverse event did not result in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of the events nausea and dizziness lasted for around 5-10 minutes, recovered on 17Mar2021. The clinical outcome of the event sore arm was lasted for 3 days and recovered on an unknown date in Mar2021. The clinical outcome of the events swollen lymph nodes and fever were recovered on unknown date in Mar2021. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Patient received her covid vaccine and about half hour later came to the pharmacy to let us know that she was experiencing some swelling on her face. She was slightly swollen under her eye on the right side of her face. The patient refused to stay for further evaluation even upon urging for her to stay. We administered 25mg of Diphenhydamine and gave her another 25mg tablet to take once she gets home. We reached out to PCP. We called the patient about 25 minytes after she left and she told us that she was doing well and would call if it worsened.

Swelling of arm; Swelling to upper arm around injection site; Stiffness of joints; Stiffness of joints especially neck; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 24-year-old non-pregnant female patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on 02Apr2021 at 20:30 (at the age of 24-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included anxiety and depression. Concomitant medications included sertraline (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) for unknown indication and from an unknown date. The patient previously received penicillin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) for unknown indication on an unknown date and experienced drug allergy. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. On 03Apr2021 at 17:00, 18 hours after the injection, the patient experienced prolonged, extensive swelling to upper arm around injection site and stiffness of joints, especially neck intensifying with swelling of arm. The adverse event did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient did not receive any treatment for the reported events. The clinical outcome of the events was swelling of arm, vaccination site swelling, joint stiffness and neck stiffness and were recovering at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
