25 2021-01-11 swelling face tingling reaction on her arms, body/tingling in the hands and arms; swelling of the face; headaches;... Read more
Close
tingling reaction on her arms, body/tingling in the hands and arms; swelling of the face; headaches; she had numbness in the face and tingling; weakness in the arms and legs, extremity weakness; fatigue; in the back, she had pain, soreness in the vertebrae in the middle going down; in the back, she had pain, soreness in the vertebrae in the middle going down; she hasn't been able to sleep in a few days, about probably 6 or 7 days.; a bump on her forehead with a high temperature; a bump on her forehead with a high temperature/ it is radiating heat, she feels her forehead hot from that spot; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer sponsored program. A contactable consumer (patient's father) and a non-contactable consumer (patient's mother) reported that a 25-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number: EL1284), via an unspecified route of administration at the right arm on 21Dec2020 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. There were no medical history and concomitant medications. After a few days on 25Dec2020, patient started to experience reactions, like a tingling reaction on her arms, body, and also swelling of the face, and she also started to have headaches. It has been like that for a while, and patient who is a health care professional was brought to the emergency room, to check on what was going on, but she was not able to get the medication they need, it was twice that the consumer he tried to bring the patient to emergency, and she still hasn't gotten medication for the symptoms. She started having reactions, she had numbness in the face and tingling, headaches, tingling in the hands and arms, and weakness in the arms and legs, extremity weakness, she felt like fatigue and also in the back, she had pain and soreness in the vertebrae in the middle going down. She has been to emergency 3 times, the last time was yesterday, and so the one thing he needs to report to Pfizer is doctors don't seem to know what to look for, they have no idea, they are looking at other things instead of looking at vaccine side effects, the patient never had problems before the vaccine, but after she started all of these side effects, they need to be looking at what can cause with the vaccine, the first time, yesterday on (03Jan2021) they did a brain MRI because of headache, as they are concerned about nerves in the brain, but a neurologist will see her sometime this month. At this time, they are ruling out things, analyzing the MRI, she did get some medication for pain, and all that stuff since she was suffering with,headache and was sent home last night. Since they said they cannot admit her, as they are afraid she could get COVID 19 in the hospital, but they make sure she is ok, and at this point, all her knows, he hasn't talked to her since last night, and hoping she is sleeping, as she hasn't been able to sleep in a few days, about probably 6 or 7 days. The consumer was wondering, it may be necessary to call the patient directly, to talk more directly to her. The patient also did have on her forehead was a spot in the middle that was raised, kind of like a raised area, from that area, it is radiating heat, she feels her forehead hot from that spot, and they take her temperature with the new handheld touchless thermometer, and it radiates heat like 100.2 to perhaps 100.4 (Dec2020). It always raises a question at these appointments, but then they take her temperature orally and it's 98 degrees (Dec2020). It was also mentioned that the patient was experiencing tingling reaction in the arms, headache, swelling, numbness in her face, and a bump on her forehead with a high temperature. These symptoms were there until yesterday, the Emergency room gave her some medicine, but the consumer hasn't heard from her, his patient was home, they haven't talked since last night. The consumer was hoping she was able to sleep. The consumer stated that the patient was given medicine, it was give to relax her, but it is like a bandaid, not a cure. Now, the consumer stated that the patient said her symptoms were the same symptoms, headache, numbness, everything after last night, she was still with problems. The patient had the very first one, at this point, the consumer doesn't know about the second one, the way she is doing. It was given to all the people she works with, most of the people, the patient works in a hospital, she is a respiratory therapist, it was given to them as they are exposed to all that the COVID 19 in a hospital. Yesterday on 03Jan2021, brain MRI, results showed that the patient was told her that everything looks, initially, looks clear good, but a neurologist will look at the report in detail. and rule out any other conditions, she has to be followed up with by a neurologist, the appointment is pending. The patient's mother asked on behalf of her daughter if this department going to be contacting the doctor for help with resolution about to resolve the health issues, what is to be expected. She added, "What are people doing when they have these severe side effects, what is Pfizer doing for them, besides taking down information, which is helping Pfizer, what helps the patient resolve side effects from the vaccine?" The patient's father stated that it seems to them, his daughter went 3 times to Emergency, the first time they said good luck with that, second time, this and that she is ok, go home, and the third time, at least they did a brain MRI, and gave her some medicine, now this morning, she is back to where she was before she went to the ER. He asked, "Why is there not more documentation, more information provided to doctors that have take care of patients, it seems to be a small group of people with these side effects, and it is really hard, the question they have is, this suffering, why doesn't Pfizer be more active in helping people, now they are investigating that, doing research to him seems like some feedback s not necessarily directed to the patient, as they are trying to take care of themselves, but to call the doctor helping her, to know a better lead to be able to help her, his daughter has missed a lot of work, has a lot of headaches, where is the hope for this to go away? What can Pfizer do to the medical community, to help them?" Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of headaches. The outcome of the events was unknown.

Close
WBCs and neutrophils and platelets elevated 3 hours later; WBCs and neutrophils and platelets elevated 3 hours later; WBCs and neutrophils and platelets elevated 3 hours later; Coat hanger neck/ shoulder pain; Coat hanger neck/ shoulder pain; flushed; felt uncomfortable; couldn't sit still; feeling clammy; saw spots; BP dropped to 60s/30s; felt like throat was closing; couldn't breathe well; hands were numb; lips were white/ blue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 25-years-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, LOT# EL1283), via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 07Jan2021 13:30 at first single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma, fibromyalgia, idiopathic hypersomnia, seasonal allergies (dust, ragweed, pollen, dander), covid-19. Concomitant medication in two weeks included duloxetine hydrochloride (CYMBALTA), modafinil, montelukast sodium (SINGULAIR), cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC), ergocalciferol (VIT D). No other vaccine in four weeks. 1-2 min after shot the patient became flushed and felt uncomfortable/ couldn't sit still, began feeling clammy, saw spots, BP dropped to 60s/30s, all other vitals stable, felt like throat was closing and couldn't breathe well, hands were numb, lips were white/ blue. No itching or hives. Resolved with trendelenburg and rest, fluids given in ED. WBCs and neutrophils and platelets elevated 3 hours later. Coat hanger neck/ shoulder pain for the next few days. Adverse event start date was 07Jan2021 01:30. Event resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. Covid was not tested post vaccination. Outcome of the event was recovering.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, the causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the reported events cannot be excluded. The information available in this report is limited and does not allow a medically meaningful assessment. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

swelling at injection site; swollen lymph nodes at under arm; Dizziness/Then felt like going to faint; Nausea; I became pale, diaphoretic, and tachycardia (100s).; I became pale, diaphoretic, and tachycardia (100s).; I became pale, diaphoretic, and tachycardia (100s).; Headache; Severe pain at injection site; Fatigue; Muscle weakness; For about 12 hours or so I had on and off fever and chills; For about 12 hours or so I had on and off fever and chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse (patient). A 25-year-old non-pregnant female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EL3249), via an unspecified route of administration on 13Jan2021 19:00 at single dose in Left arm for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included allergies to Sulfa drugs, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), seasonal allergic rhinitis. Concomitant medication included ibuprofen (ADVIL), amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL), fluticasone propionate (FLONASE), clarithromycin (CLARITIN). Historical Vaccine included first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EJ1685) on 23Dec2020 18:00 at single dose which was administered at Left Arm for COVID-19 immunization. There were no other vaccines received in four weeks. The patient did not have covid-19 prior to vaccination and covid-19 not tested post vaccination. The patient started with dizziness and nausea on 14Jan2021 12:30. Then felt like she was going to faint on 14Jan2021 12:30. The patient became pale, diaphoretic, and tachycardia (100s) on 14Jan2021 12:30. Also had a headache and severe pain at injection site as well as fatigue and muscle weakness on 14Jan2021 12:30. For about 12 hours or so the patient had on and off fever and chills as well the rest of the symptoms listed above which started from 14Jan2021 12:30. Today (40+ hours later) on 15Jan2021, the patient developed swelling at injection site and swollen lymph nodes at under arm. No treatment received for the reported events. The outcome of the events was recovered in Jan2021.

Experienced dizziness the first week after vaccination; Axillary lymph node swelling to arm of injection; Axillary lymph node swelling to arm of injection; hands and feet tingling/numbness/Feels as if hands and feet are falling asleep often; hands and feet tingling/numbness/Feels as if hands and feet are falling asleep often; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (who is also the patient). A 25-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, on 30Dec2020 14:00, at single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to BNT162B2 vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination and was not tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. On 06Jan2021 at 14:00, first week after the vaccination, the patient experienced dizziness, axillary lymph node swelling to arm of injection 1 week until now after vaccination, and hands and feet tingling/numbness at random times of the day and feels as if hands and feet are falling asleep often. The events resulted to "doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit". No treatment for the events was given. The outcome of the events was not recovered. The events were assessed as non-serious. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

large inflamed swollen lymph nodes under her arm / extremely swollen large lymph node under the right arm; large inflamed swollen lymph nodes under her arm / extremely swollen large lymph node under the right arm; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer reporting for a female patient (daughter). A 25-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number and expiration date were unknown) via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on an unspecified date at SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunization. Medical history was reported as none. There were no concomitant medications. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on unspecified date via unspecified route of administration in the right arm at single dose for covid-19 immunization. She received both shots (first and second dose) in the same arm. The reporter stated that patient (daughter) took her second shot (Covid-19 Vaccine by Pfizer) on unspecified date (reported as "this past Tuesday") and the next morning she woke up with a large inflamed swollen lymph nodes under her arm; upper arm but certainly it's in her armpit side. Reporter wanted to know how long the lymph nodes will just take swollen. The event was further described as extremely swollen large lymph node under the right arm. This happened on unspecified date, reported as the night patient received the vaccine (also reported as occurred the next morning). She did have additional side effects such as fatigue but no fever, no diarrhea, no upset stomach. Fatigue to the point she couldn't go to work on the day after receiving the vaccine. The fatigue passed but not the swollen lymph nodes. Patient went to see the doctor and said it could be a possible side effect of the vaccine or something else. Ultrasound was performed on unspecified date with unknown results. No treatment was received for the event (not at this time) but patient has been to physician. The outcome of the event "large inflamed swollen lymph nodes under her arm / extremely swollen large lymph node under the right arm" was not recovered. Outcome of the event fatigue was recovered on unspecified date. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.
25 2021-02-08 lymph node swelling, lymph node pain Swollen lymph node (or unknown lump) behind the left collarbone; painful on it's own and painful to ... Read more
Close
Swollen lymph node (or unknown lump) behind the left collarbone; painful on it's own and painful to touch. Lymph node swelled up to about the size of a cherry and has stayed that size. Began at about 11 AM on 2/8 and has continued through now (~4 PM 2/9). Intense muscle aches, worse two days after the vaccine, instead of just one day after. Aching of the muscles around the eyes (the ones you would use to squint and the top of the cheeks), the scalp, neck (the base of the skull and trapezius), biceps, aching around the wrist joints, hip flexors, quadriceps, and ankle joints. Found relief with 500 mg acetaminophen throughout the day.

25 2021-02-09 swelling face Within 15 minutes my vision began to blur, I became shaky and disoriented. My heart rate increased a... Read more
Close
Within 15 minutes my vision began to blur, I became shaky and disoriented. My heart rate increased and it felt as though my blood pressure decreased rapidly. After 30 minutes my symptoms had worsened and I was so disoriented I was not able to seek medical attention while being observed. I exited the building and once I got into my car my face (specifically under my eyes and on my cheeks) began swelling and a red burning rash appeared. By the time I got home (10 more minutes) I needed Benadryl immediately, I was not able to complete my sentences and all other symptoms had become more intense. I continued to take Benadryl every 4 hours for the next few days due to the symptoms consistently rebounding. I had one episode of throat tightness but it passed without use of my epipen. I checked my pulse and blood pressure frequently with the lowest reading being 93/60. Lethargy, shakiness, confusion, high heart rate all are still present after 5 days. The rash went away after 48 hours.
25 2021-02-14 white blood cell count increased Rash/hives all over body, increased blood pressure, heart rate 150. Struggling to breathe.
25 2021-02-15 lymph node swelling, oral herpes Patient developed headache, fever and extreme sweating the evening after vaccination. Also, she deve... Read more
Close
Patient developed headache, fever and extreme sweating the evening after vaccination. Also, she developed gum swelling, purple spots on the gums, sores in the mouth, and fever blisters on the lips. Symptoms worsened and patient went to the facility to get a COVID test, which was negative. Over the weekend, patient developed swollen lymph nodes/neck and also noticed a lump in the left breast (same side as vaccination). Patient was nursing 11 month old and supply diminished (never returned). Went to stat care and was diagnosed with strep throat over the weekend. About 2 weeks post-vaccinations symptoms resolved and lump in breast no longer present.

Close
Chills, body aches - lasted approx. 1 day Headache, fatigue - lasted approx. 2 days Injection site swelling and Swollen lymph nodes in right armpit - lasted approx. 5 days Alternated Tylenol and Motrin to relieve head and body aches. All swelling reduced gradually without direct treatment.
25 2021-02-28 lymph node swelling Lymph node swelling in neck, armpits and groin. Difficulty swallowing.
25 2021-03-04 white blood cell count increased I made sure to hydrate and eat well the day of the vaccine. I have had no allergic reactions to any ... Read more
Close
I made sure to hydrate and eat well the day of the vaccine. I have had no allergic reactions to any medications/ injections in the past and I was not worried about this one. I didn't take any meds beforehand besides my normal morning modafinil. I have no fear of needles. I received the vaccine in the auditorium about 1:25pm. The RN did a fantastic job, went through all of the information, no pain at all with the injection. As I was sitting in my chair for monitoring, a few minutes in I began to feel very uncomfortable. I felt clammy/sweaty and kept shifting my weight in my seat. I didn't want to make a big deal of it at first because I worried it was all in my head. But I became more and more uncomfortable. I laid my head down on the little desk, no help. I closed my eyes, no help. About 10 minutes or so in I decided to ask if they had water available. I slowly got up and walked to the back of the room. I couldn't even get the question out of my mouth before the nurse told me to sit down. Apparently I was white as a ghost. They got a wheelchair and wheeled me to the space behind the auditorium. By then I was starting to feel like my throat was closing and I saw spots in my peripheral vision. It was kind of a blur from there. I tried to take deep breaths. I drank a few sips of water and poured some on a paper towel to wet my forehead (and spilled all over my lap because I was a little disoriented at this point). My BP was 60s/40s and then 60s/30s. A rapid response was called. They moved me to a cart flat on my back with my legs elevated. My fingers and toes were starting to go numb and my lips were apparently blue/ white. After laying for a few minutes in Trendelenburg my BP began to resolve and my breathing started to ease a bit. No further intervention was done by the rapid team. I was taken by the Rapid RN to the ED for monitoring. They eventually pushed the cart into a room and took some vitals and an EKG. They had me stand and move to a wheelchair. I felt horrible but improved from before. They had me sit in a wheelchair in the lobby for a few hours before taking me back and placing an IV and drawing labs (I believe it was 3 hours from the initial reaction). I gave a urine sample. They then put me in a wheelchair and wheeled me back into the lobby for some more time. Then, they wheeled me back to a room where they gave some lactated ringers and a PA and MD saw me. By then my BP and breathing was completely resolved. The MD said he wasn't fully convinced it was just a vasovagal episode because I haven't had issues with vaccines in the past and I was well hydrated and my HR was normal. It partly fit the picture for an allergic reaction/ severe immune response d/t the feeling of throat closing, the BP drop, and the elevated WBCs. They advised that I list the vaccine as an allergy and do not get the second dose, especially since I had COVID back in September.

25 2021-03-15 peripheral swelling Within 1 hour of injection (10:00am), began experiencing fatigue that got increasingly worse. By 2:0... Read more
Close
Within 1 hour of injection (10:00am), began experiencing fatigue that got increasingly worse. By 2:00pm, had slurred speech; severe fatigue; red skin on hands, face, neck; balance problems and dizziness; swollen hands. That evening through the next morning, I was experienced severe flu-like symptoms, including vertigo, extremely severe fatigue, and full-body muscle aches. My temperature was slightly elevated (98.7) from my "baseline," which is around 96.7. On Saturday, I was very tired, no appetite, still experiencing some vertigo and muscle aches. Symptoms improved overnight and by Sunday evening, I was mostly back to normal, with some lingering fatigue.

25 2021-03-19 peripheral swelling About 30 seconds after the injection I felt a strange sharp pain right under where the injection sit... Read more
Close
About 30 seconds after the injection I felt a strange sharp pain right under where the injection site was. I was advised to sit near the nurses station for 30 minutes instead of 15 due to my medical history. One of the nurses came by to check on me and as we were chatting my entire left shoulder and up my neck suddenly got red and rashy. I looked down and both of my arms were rashy as well. I began to experience itching everywhere. The nurse gave me 50 mg of benedryl and monitored me for about 40 minutes. The rash went down and they had my husband come pick me up. I called my pcp and advised them or the situation. She asked to keep her informed and if anything got worse to administer the Epi-Pen and go to the ER. Once home I slept for about 5 1/2 hours and then woke up in the afternoon. I had a minor headache and my arm had started to swell, but the rash was completely gone. As of today my arm is still red and swollen under the injection site, and itches quite a lot.

Close
About 10 minutes after the second dose, I noticed the hives and irritation come on my throat, neck and my arm. I talked to the people who were monitoring and they gave me 50 mg of Benadryl and they kept me for 45- one hour. They Benadryl took about 20-30 minutes to for having the hives and irritation go away. After that happened, I went home and I started to get body aches and feeling very fatigued; a little bit nauseous. I did have some soreness and swelling on my arm after vaccine that lasted two or three days. The fatigue and body aches lasted for one day. The hives and irritation on my throat and neck and arm didn't come back after the dose of Benadryl. I had a doctor appt on Feb 8 about the side affects of the vaccine - he told me if hives came back to take Benadryl.

sharp shooting pain in my right armpit (same side as injection)./my right armpit was swollen; sharp shooting pain in my right armpit (same side as injection)./my right armpit was swollen; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other HCP. This 25-year-old female other-HCP reported that she received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 04Feb2021 10:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE DOSE, dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 14Jan2021 16:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included food allergy from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. he patient reported 24 hours after getting the shot, I started having sharp shooting pain in my right armpit (same side as injection). 36 hours later, my right armpit was swollen. It has now been 4 days and my right armpit is still very swollen- have been treating with warm compress. Still have pain but has decreased. 25 2021-04-01 peripheral swelling The next morning following the vaccine injection, (4/1/21) I woke up to pain in my lymphnodes in my ... Read more
Close
The next morning following the vaccine injection, (4/1/21) I woke up to pain in my lymphnodes in my right armpit. I recieved the injection in my right arm. It was a dull achey pain but upon palpation became a sharp shooting pain that radiated from my armpit into my back and under my ribcage. There was also swelling and it to hurt have my right arm resting along my side. Today, on 4/2/21, I am still experiencing this pain, however, it is less severe. To treat, I have been taking 2 acetominaphen approximately every six hours. It still hurts if I am to rest my arm at my side.
25 2021-04-08 swelling face I'd had Bell's Palsy (BP) twice in my life (once in 2013 and once in 2015). I have not had it since ... Read more
Close
I'd had Bell's Palsy (BP) twice in my life (once in 2013 and once in 2015). I have not had it since 2015 until I got vaccinated on 3/29/21 and began to develop BP symptoms on the evening of 4/6/21 (headache on right side of my head/temple, odd sensation on right side of my tongue, almost like I burned it on a hot beverage) but I didn't think anything of it. I went to sleep and then, on the morning of 4/7/21, I woke up feeling extremely fatigued, brain fogged, and weak. I didn't notice any of the BP symptoms until I went to brush my teeth and realized I had lost motor function in the right side of my mouth. I immediately made a telehealth appointment with an Urgent Care doctor in order to get an Rx of Prednisone. I began taking the Prednisone around 3pm on Wednesday, 4/7/21. I also have been taking vitamin B-12 and a Women's Multivitamin to help regenerate nerve function. However, since starting the prednisone, my symptoms have continued to develop. Symptoms currently include: right side of my face is extremely swollen; I have lost mobility on the right side of my face, the right side of my tongue still feels numb; right eye tearing non-stop; some mild ear pain in right inner ear; slight pins-and-needles sensation in my fingers on my right hand; difficulty eating and drinking; still feeling fatigued. I have recovered from BP twice before so I am not too worried about having it again. I just think the FDA needs to put out a warning to the public that there may be a correlation between the COVID-19 mRNA vaccines and Bell's Palsy recurrences. I know this is not a coincidence, and my BP relapse was a result of my body experiencing an immune reaction from the vaccine.
25 2021-04-10 lymph node pain, lymph node swelling swollen lymph nodes in right armpit causing patient pain as of Friday (04/08/2021)
25 2021-04-11 lymph node swelling I received the vaccine in my left arm and noticed the pain in my left arm and armpit the day after r... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine in my left arm and noticed the pain in my left arm and armpit the day after receiving the shot. 2 days after receiving the shot, I noticed the swelling of my left lymph node in my left armpit. It was very painful to move my arm or leave my arm resting in a normal position since it would put pressure on my lymph node. I had very limited mobility on days 2,3 and 4 after the vaccine but quickly improved starting day 5 with very minimal pain. I had a video call with a doctor who recommended 800mg of ibuprofen every 8 hours & warm compress on the lymph node. In general, I had very minimal symptoms from the first vaccine except the lymph node swelling & pain. Starting day 5 post vaccine I was basically back to normal & have felt good ever since.
25 2021-04-13 peripheral swelling Swelling and redness of the arm within an hour after the vaccine. Tingling began in middle, ring, an... Read more
Close
Swelling and redness of the arm within an hour after the vaccine. Tingling began in middle, ring, and pinky fingers within 20 minutes of injection. Numbness began within the first hour. Within two hours, I lost strength and 60% use of my left hand. The pinky and ring finger of my left hand have been either completely numb or tingling ever since my shot over one week ago. I noticed mild numbness about 3-4 days after the first dose, but assumed I had just slept funny. When my arm became red and hand became tingly after my second dose, I realized this was an effect of the vaccine and not merely a pinched nerve in my sleep.
25 2021-04-14 oral herpes The first dose of the Pfizer vaccine was taken on March 15th at 8:30. Within a week I started feelin... Read more
Close
The first dose of the Pfizer vaccine was taken on March 15th at 8:30. Within a week I started feeling weak joints, headaches followed by a sharp pain on the occipital lobe. I started my period for the second time that month, which was odd because it never happened to me before. I went to work that week, but by Friday (March 30th) I was not able to handle the pain so after work I went to the doctor and they took blood to see if there was anything going on. The result came back the following day and everything was normal. I was given medicine (muscle relaxers) for the occipital pain, but it was not enough. At that time I was not sure what was the cause of it, I thought it was a bad flu, but I didn't come to the conclusion that it was because of the vaccine, because a week had passed by, so I thought it was impossible. The doctor asked for me to take an X-Ray for the occipital pain, so I did (March 30th) and it resulted in everything being fine. She also recommended for me to get an abdominal ultrasound to see if my uterus was fine due to the second period. I currently took the second Pfizer dose in the same location, but this time around I felt all of these symptoms within 3 hours of the vaccination. I started feeling lightheaded and dazed, my joints started feeling weak, my mouth and tongue started feeling sensitive (fever blisters and sensitive to anything that is acidic, spicy, etc). I have not visited the doctor this time around because the pain is tolerable. I have noticed in increase of joint pain as the days go by.

Friday April 2, 2021, 2:00pm - Medical visit: Family Practice, Diagnoses: Left Foot Pain, Subcutaneous Nodule Of Foot. Ultrasound ordered. Tuesday April 6, 2021, 10:30am - Ultrasound of lower left foot, Diagnoses: Thrombophlebitis Of Superficial Lower Left Extremity Tuesday April 6, 2021, 4pm - Emergency Department. Ultrasound of full left leg. Additional pain, tenderness, and swelling.

I told her to take Benadryl and to go to the ER or to the immediate care. Within 1 hour of receiving the vaccine, I had mild tongue swelling, shortness of breath, fingers swelling, intense sweating and faintness. Within 24 hours of receiving the vaccine, hives developed on my left thigh. The tongue swelling, shortness of breath and faintness happened on and off for the first day. It resolved on its own by the next day. The hives got progressively worse and peaked roughly 48 hours after getting the vaccine. They slowly faded, but are still faintly noticeable. I had general malaise for the rest of the week. I have photos showing the progression of the hives.

My right rib cage hurt so bad that I couldn't sleep on my right side. My legs, back, and pelvic bones were in so much pain as well. I felt as if my bones were going to break or I had severely bruised my bones. Breathing, coughing, sneezing hurt because of my rib cage hurting. My migraine had not gone away, and my lymph nodes were really swollen. Couldn't put my arms down, my neck was swollen and walking hurt because my legs were swollen. This occurred for 24 hours. Next day, migraine is gone and left a headache. Swelling is still prominent and bones still hurt.

anaphylactic reaction; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 25-year-old female patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: En6203), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on an unspecified date (at the age of 25-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient is not pregnant. Medical history included COVID prior vaccination on unspecified date. The patient had no known allergies. Concomitant medication included unspecified birth control pills. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: En9581) in the right arm on 09Feb2021 at 02:00 PM (at the age of 25-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. No other vaccine in four weeks. On 21Mar2021 at 14:00 after her second vaccine the patient had an anaphylactic reaction. It was something she had eaten before so not new to her body. It happened again on 27Apr2021. Still from things she eats normally. Both occurrences happened 30 minutes after eating and came on quickly. The event resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care, Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the event which included Benedryl, steroids, and given an epipen. The patient recovered from the event on unspecified date.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information provided, known drug safety profile and plausible temporal association, the causality between the suspect drug and the event cannot be excluded.

A 25-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date at age of 25-year-old at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The caller stated her daughter had the vaccine on Thursday and was having bad side effects. She stated her lymph nodes in her neck were severely/extremely swollen and painful where she could barely turn her neck and her neck was sore. She was having severe lower abdominal pain that started that evening, bad first two days and had subsided. The patient was really tired. She had a sore throat, a headache, and overall feels horrible. She stated 3 days ago there were reports of hundreds of women in her age group having these same symptoms and this information was not available to them prior to the vaccine. She stated there were woman dying in Norway from thrombosis, 20 women in their reproductive years. Woman this age were getting severe reactions and there is no available information on this. She asked, how long will these symptoms last. How to make the swelling and pain go away. Stated that she was fine before the vaccine and currently she was not fine. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

Close
On May 11 (ten days after second shot), I broke out in full body hives (face, arms, legs, entire abdomen). Extreme itchiness all over body - unable to sleep. Body was entirely red with raised white welts. Visited urgent care doctors, dermatologist, and allergist. Landed on a treatment plan with the allergist with a strong dose of steroids and antihistamines, which have mostly resolved the symptoms as of 5/18 (Biaxin, Medrol, Probiotic, Pepcid, Xyzal, Allegra, Benadryl). I was prescribed a Prednisone taper along with Zyrtec from Urgent Care on May 12, but my symptoms did not improve until starting the allergist's plan on 5/15.

Close
All of the below occurred after Pfizer shot #2 administered on 4/1/2021. Pfizer shot #1 was administered on 3/12/2021 with minimal effects lasting less than 24 hours (arm soreness, flu-like symptoms, etc.). 1) Severe worsening of costochondritis (chronic chest pain) to the point of breathing difficulty and inability to lie down. Began 4/1/2021 and became unbearable the evening of 4/7/2021, requiring an ER trip the same night (see Item 19). This pain has since continued to come and go, worse than I ever had it before the vaccine. 2) Very severe worsening of tinnitus (ringing/pulsing in ears) - lasted 1.5 months, from 4/1/2021 to around 5/15/2021. 3) Severe hormone imbalance symptoms (waves of severe nausea occurring several times daily, extremely late and painful/heavy period, swelling in ankles & feet, etc.) for ~1.5 months, from late April 2021 to around 5/15/2021. I cannot identify any other changes or life factors besides the vaccine that would have caused these issues.

She was concerned about her. She wanted to know if she should get the 2nd vaccine. The outcome of the other events was unknown. Information on Lot /Batch Number has been requested. The outcome was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Close
Nausea beginning roughly five hours after injection which lasted about 6 hours - no medication taken to cease. Headache beginning roughly two hours after injection - Advil taken (two OTC tablets). The headache persisted roughly 24 hours from onset. Painful arm at site of injection began roughly 10 hours after shot and lasted about 48 hours. Swollen and painful lymph nodes under both right and left armpits started two days after injection (6/10 in the evening) and lasted until 6/13 in the evening.

" She called and notified her MD and was advised to not take anymore COVID vaccine. She was not seen by a MD for evaluation. States swelling resolved by evening of 5/27/2021 and has had no more problems.

25 2021-06-29 c-reactive protein increased Patient received 2nd dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 6/16/21. She reported having myalgia, inject... Read more
Close
Patient received 2nd dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 6/16/21. She reported having myalgia, injection site pain, and some breathlessness following the dose. The following day, she noted sharp chest pain worse when she took a deep breath. She went to bed she woke up on 6/18 with worsening sharp chest pain worse with deep breath, worse with laying back and better with sitting up: 8/10 intensity without radiation. She did feel short of breath when having the pain. Patient's ESR was elevated at 30. hs-CRP was 69. Patient was given IV morphine and Toradol for symptomatic treatment. Troponins trended up with values of 0.029, 0.070, and 0.546ng/mL. Echocardiogram was performed, which showed normal pericardium and normal LV and RV size and function. Patient was discharged with prescriptions for colchicine and ibuprofen.

itchy rash; swelling on bottom half of face and jawline; Bubbly rash; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 25-year-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Lot number: ER8727), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 21Mar2021 at 11:45 (at the age of 25-year-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was not reported. The patient had no known allergies to medications, food, or other product. The patient did not receive any other vaccination within four weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Concomitant medications included KYLEENA IUD for an unknown indication from an unknown date. On 21Mar2021 at 23:00, the patient experienced bubbly, itchy rash and swelling on bottom half of face and jawline. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. It was unknown if the patient received treatment for the reported events. The clinical outcome of the events bubbly, itchy rash and swelling on bottom half of face and jawline was unknown at the time of report. No follow-up attempts are needed. 25 2021-07-02 swelling Yesterday my back started having the same problems; Arms hurt; My lips and eyes were swollen; Neck s... Read more
Close
Yesterday my back started having the same problems; Arms hurt; My lips and eyes were swollen; Neck swelling; My lips and eyes were swollen; I got hives and rashes all over my face, arms and chest thighs; I got hives and rashes all over my face, arms and chest thighs; chills; My muscles were hurting so much; Fever; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer sponsored program. A contactable consumer (patient herself) reported that a 25-year-female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number and expiration date was not reported) via an unspecified route of administration on 08Apr2021 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Patient medical history included She was allergic to clams and COVID-19. Concomitant medications were not reported. Lab data included as blood work on an unspecified date results reported as allergic to clams (seafood) and COVID-19 test on an unspecified date in Jan2021 with positive results. On 23Apr2021 she got hives and rashes all over face, arms and chest thighs. On 23Apr2021 at night she went to the ER. They gave her Benadryl and steroids to see what happens. They did not prescribed anything, got one Benadryl and one steroid. They told her to just to observe. The next day she was fine. On 24Apr2021 started to get the hives again. On 27Apr2021 it was reported as patient lips and eyes were swollen and she saw her doctor and had blood work to see if she was allergic to anything. She was allergic to clams (seafood) but nothing else. In Apr 2021 she experienced chills, fever it was normal but two weeks later she got all these rashes and hives. Her doctor gave me Benadryl for 10 days and steroid for 5 days. She was scheduled on 29Apr2021 for the 2nd dose. She did not get, doctor wanted me to wait until she was done with steroids. Two days ago, her steroids were done, hives were going away it was the 28th and 29th her arms hurt. On the 29th her back started the same thing (like my hands and arms). Her muscles were hurting so much, felt like poking me with needles. On 02May2021 back started having the same problems. She was COVID positive in Jan and got better from it. Caller asked if there was seafood in the vaccine. Response was received as shellfish, fish, seafood and emailed as requested. She had a side effect after the first dose of the vaccine. It was asked as should she get the second dose and response was she should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine if she had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if she had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The decision to receive the second dose for any other reason cannot be made by Pfizer. We refer you to speak to your healthcare provider about the risks of the vaccine compared to the risks of potentially not being fully protected against COVID-19 infection. She had a bad reaction on the 23Apr had a swollen lips and neck. The outcome of events (Fever and chills) was recovered on an unspecified date in Apr2021 and unknown for other events. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.
25 2021-07-05 white blood cell count increased So on the Saturday after my vaccine, I was having chest pains which were like shooting pains which w... Read more
Close
So on the Saturday after my vaccine, I was having chest pains which were like shooting pains which was pretty strange. I was driving so I pulled over and had some water then continued on. I had dinner and it continued, these shooting pains in my chest. I called the paramedics and had them evaluate me. They hooked me up to an EKG machine and they were alarmed and they recommended I go with them to the ER. I don't really know why they were that alarmed, I didn't feel that bad. The paramedic was like I have been working in cardiac care for 15 years. They wouldn't even allow me to walk down my stairs, they put me in a wheelie thing and I got in the paramedic vehicle. They said I was having premature ventricular contractions. They tested my blood levels and all that stuff and I was not having any indication of a heart attack or anything. They sent me home the next day, on 4/4/2021.

A 25-year-old non-pregnant female patient received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EN8720), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 24Mar2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 25-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included rheumatoid arthritis and migraines. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had been tested for COVID-19. Concomitant medications included hydroxychloroquine (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), vitamins (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), ethinylestradiol; ferrous fumarate; norethisterone acetate (LO LOESTRIN FE) and escitalopram oxalate (LEXAPRO), all for unknown indications from unknown dates. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EN6199), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 03Mar2021 at 14:30 (at the age of 25-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 24Mar2021 at 18:00, the patient experienced muscle aches, low grade fever (100.1 for 24 hours), swollen lymph nodes, chills and headache. The adverse events did not result in a visit to the doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient underwent lab test on 09Mar2021 and 16Mar2021 which included Covid PCR test via nasal swab and the test result was negative. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events muscle aches, low grade fever (100.1 for 24 hours), swollen lymph nodes, chills and headache. The clinical outcomes of the events muscle aches, low grade fever (100.1 for 24 hours), swollen lymph nodes, chills and headache were recovering at the time of the report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

25 2021-07-20 c-reactive protein increased 25 year old otherwise healthy female who presented with chest pain 1 week after her March 4, 2021 PF... Read more
Close
25 year old otherwise healthy female who presented with chest pain 1 week after her March 4, 2021 PFizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. Chest pain was initially constant and severe, alleviated with leaning forward, worsened with lying supine. She visited her local Emergency Department 4 times and has had 1 outpatient cardiologist visit. Labs, including troponin, ESR, CRP, EKG, echo and echo stress test were negative. Naproxen and colchicine started empirically which alleviated her pain. Patient's chest pain is still persisting daily 4 months later, although no longer constant. Chest pain now lasts few minutes at a time without clear trigger. Pt is not pregnant, no history of drug allergy, no medical history of other illness.
25 2021-07-20 lymph node swelling Immediately after getting the shot within 2 minutes I started feeling very flushed and very warm. I ... Read more
Close
Immediately after getting the shot within 2 minutes I started feeling very flushed and very warm. I did not have difficulty breathing so they sent me home, I took my jacket off and I had a rash from my neck, across my collar bone, across my chest and my back. My neck felt super tight so I ended up going to urgent care they did blood work and they said it must have been a swollen lymph node. They sent me to the hospital and they did an ultrasound, and it came back as nonconclusive, I also had like the more traditional symptoms, head aches, stomach ache. By the time I had the ultrasound it had already been a month. the normal symptoms went away after the week, but the tightness in my neck persisted for the whole month. They did the ultrasound and blood work and the official diagnosis was a lymphatic reaction. I was really just having difficulty swallowing and laying flat. After urgent care and had the us I followed up with my PCP and she prescribed some steroids. It took about 2 months to fully settle back down and for the inflammation to go away. Because I had trouble swallowing solid foods I lost about 20 pounds.

This is second out of 2 reports with second dose information. A 25-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection; Lot Number: EW0196; Expiration date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 02Jul2021 (at the age of 25-years-old) as dose 2, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Investigation assessment, additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect, prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks) included none. Family medical history included neoplasm malignant (cancer) from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. The patient previously took Prevnar 13 for pneumonia (last vaccine patient got 6 months ago, they actually told her that this vaccine might have a chance of lesser mitigated side effects but that was not the case. Patient reported that last one was. She was in another country and there you can get Prevnar 13 at any age not as like 65 or 67 like it was here. Patient did not have NDC lot expiration for the Prevnar 13 she received. Adverse events following prior vaccinations included none and was surprised because she had never had reactions). Flu vaccine (patient stated she reacts badly to the flu vaccine. Patient did not have any NDC lot expiration for the flu vaccine she received, did not get the flu vaccine in 10 years because she reacted badly and did not get the flu in 10 years) and took first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EW0217), via unspecified route in left arm on 11Jun2021 (at the age of 25-years-old) for COVID-19 immunisation and experienced arm hurt a little and had swollen lymph nodes. At 03Jul2021 06:00, the patient experienced nausea, a weird pain, she will be fine but if anything touches her like clothes or the couch when she sits down everything burns, it irritates her skin, her neck is stiff, sweating, chills, fever. On the same day, the patient also experienced she could not eat, her lymph nodes are still swollen now and it has been over a month, they got even bigger with the second dose on 03Jul2021. Patient was calling about the vaccine she was told to call here and basically report her effects. She clarified it was the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. She does not have mailing address or email. Patient said the first vaccine was fine, her arm hurt a little. Her mother got it at the same time same place, and she was fine but the caller's hurt a little bit, but her mother felt great. And again, after the second dose her mother felt perfect, she had not had a single side effect. Caller said for herself it was different, she was fine for the first 12 hours, she got the second dose at 6:30 PM on 02Jul2021 (Friday) at 6AM on 03Jul2021 (Saturday) she was burning with fever it started and got to around 101 degrees. She was sweating, and had chills and that was everything to be expected but what really confused her was her lymph nodes, she wasn't told at the pharmacy they could swell and suddenly she felt this one under her arm and had cancer in her family so she freaked out but then they told her it could be from the vaccine but basically it cause her lymph node to swell and it felt like there is an egg it was the size of a mushroom under her skin. She was 25 years old, and her neck is stiff, it had been a week and she could barely move her neck her back and just everything hurts. it is a weird pain, she will be fine but if anything touched her like clothes or the couch when she sat down everything burns, it irritated her skin. She couldn't eat, she was nauseous she threw up water. It was awful she drank a little water and threw it right up. All the events began the next day of vaccination, 03Jul2021 at 6 AM in the morning, 12 hours after the second dose. She clarifies the swollen lymph nodes began after the first vaccine, she got the first dose on 11Jun2021 and maybe on 13Jun2021 she was in the shower and felt the lump and freaked out and began calling doctors and they said she had just got the vaccine and it could be that but she is still going to have it checked out because there was triple negative in her family and her lymph nodes are still swollen now and it has been over a month, they got even bigger with the second dose. Patient mother was worried because she was trying to get the patient to eat something, but she couldn't eat, she just didn't expect that to be a side effect, everything felt disgusting with the nausea, it was not fun. They said a very low percentage have the swollen lymph nodes, so she wanted to report. Patient did not see expiration date or NDC number on vaccine card. They just have the date when administered. And did not have any dose information, it was injection to the left arm for both first and second dose. Indication was stated as to not get COVID. Grandmother, mother, aunt, and best friend of patient were all high risk, so patient wanted to be vaccinated. Vaccination time was reported as 6:30 or 7 PM. Patient asked there if was going to be a third shot right, like a booster, because she was dreading it since getting the second shot. Caller declined to be transferred for questions about potential booster dose of the vaccine and declined to be provided with phone number to medication information. On 03Jul2021, the patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 101 degrees. The clinical outcome of the events was unknown.

25 2021-07-22 swelling, swelling face On Thursday, 6/24/21, PT (DOB: 12/31/1995) received her first dose of Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine (LOT #... Read more
Close
On Thursday, 6/24/21, PT (DOB: 12/31/1995) received her first dose of Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine (LOT #: EW0217) at 10:16 am in her left deltoid. During assessment questions, client stated she has severe allergic reaction to penicillin and experiences anaphylaxis and was to be observed for 30 minutes. At approximately 10:21 am, while in Observation Area, client stated to EMTs she was experiencing facial flushing, slight swelling from the neck to right before her eyes, numbness and tingling in her throat, neck and face. She denied SOB but stated it was "difficult to catch her breath." Client sat in anti gravity chair and was given water that she drank. Vitals offered but were not taken for client. EMT offered oral Benadryl to which the client denied and stated she had Benadryl at home. After 20 minutes client stated to EMTs that her symptoms subsided and felt ok to return home. Client was educated by EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Client was also encouraged to sign-up on v-safe. Client left vaccination site with a steady gait at approximately 11:15 am.
25 2021-07-23 swelling face Vaccine was administered at around 6:30 PM. Patient was stable during vaccination and in the 15 minu... Read more
Close
Vaccine was administered at around 6:30 PM. Patient was stable during vaccination and in the 15 minute observation period afterward. Patient left the facility and returned 10 minutes later presenting with redness and swelling of the face and complaints of difficulty breathing. Patient was sat down and 0.3mg of EpiPen was administered. Symptoms rapidly improved and patient was transported to a nearby medical facility via EMS.
